name: Embassy Suites Indianapolis - Downtown

reviews.text: I actually hadn't stayed at an Embassy Suites since the late 90's, and I was surprised to find this hotel was still stuck in that era. My biggest complaint, though you see this in Europe all the time, is that there is no way to lower the room temperature in the winter since the air conditioning system is off. So, if your room is hot, sorry, that's just how its going to be.
reviews.title: Hotel is old and tired, but well located and reasonably priced.

reviews.text: I was also there for the Jets-Colts game, so they had a full house. The free breakfast was a zoo. They tried to keep up valiantly, but there were 30-person lines to get a drink. Keep that in mind if you are there during an event.
reviews.title: Disgusting...Worst Embassy Suites Hotel I have ever stayed in.
Nice hotel but can be noisy
reviews.text: Otherwise, the hotel was as advertised and a reasonable value. I'd probably try a different hotel the next time I'm in town.

We stayed here for a Colts game and it is the worst Embassy Suites I have ever stayed in. First they tried to put us in a "corner" room which had only a single and a double and an odd room shape. The carpet and walls were dirty. They moved us to a regular shaped room after our request, but the room was still dirty, there had been a water leak near the window and the carpet was still badly stained. Bathrooms were moldy, and the room smelled of cigarette smoke. If you're expecting Embassy Suites quality....forget it. The good reviews for this hotel must be plugs by the owners because this hotel is a one star hotel at best.
reviews.title: Embassy Delivers Yet Again.
OMG, not cool!
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel to stay at downtown but look out for the groups that stay there. They had a youth group and the kids would not go to sleep. They were up making noises outside of the rooms until 2 a.m. I called the front desk and they told me they were having trouble controlling these kids so you may not get much sleep there.

I'm very surprised that reviewers rated this hotel "terrible!" This was my second or third stay at this hotel, and I've been satisfied every time. My only complaints are that the parking is expensive--$20 per night, and, as with many upscale hotels, free internet service is not provided.
reviews.title: Great choice, great location

reviews.text: There are dozens of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, and it's within a 5 minute walk of the state government buildings.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel With good Services & Amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I traveled to Indianapolis for a government business conference that week. I had stay at Embassy Suites in the downtown district, the hotel is in a great area . Everything is right there Mall Food Convention Center all located right downtown by the Embassy Suites. Service was good from check in to check out. The complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast offers you a variety of healthy, great tasting options and the nightly Manager's Reception features a variety of cold beverages
reviews.title: Fair to okay Embassy Suites that needs to be improved.

reviews.text: While the Downtown Embassy Suites is not a horrible hotel, it does need to be improved.
reviews.title: Jazzfest

reviews.text: First of all; whoever designed the front entrance needs to go back to architecture school. When you arrive you are greeted by steps as well as an almost unusable winding luggage ramp. Plus one you get up the stairs you must take an escalator up to the main lobby level. If you have to use a luggage cart you must use the smelly service elevator.
reviews.title: Not up to standard

likes.disliked: — SLOW elevator, hot and stuffy room improperly working hot tubs

reviews.text: Rooms were spacious and comfortable, enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. location is great.
reviews.title: Downtown Fun
"The Hampton Inn Experience" at Embassy Suites
reviews.text: My wife and I attended a conference in Indianapolis and stayed at the downtown Embassy Suites. Though the discounted conference rate was good, there isn't much value for the money. The front entrance -- well, there isn't one. It involves trying to find it, then negotiating several dozen stairs. Once you get in, you arrive in a dark waiting area, and need to take an escalator to reach the lobby -- very poor design.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The heating in the rooms is poor (you really can't control it very well with in-room thermostats), bathroom is small and the less said about the breakfast the better.
reviews.title: Great location and lots of value

reviews.text: And I have to raise my pet peeve about $12 for daily WiFi at a hotel charging $200/night. If Panera Bread can give you free WiFi, I see no reason why this hotel can't.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Stay at the Embassy Suites

reviews.text: When in Indy, if prices are comparable, you'd be far better off staying at the Hyatt across the street, or the Westin not far away. A very mediocre Embassy Suite.
reviews.title: never paid soooo much to be sooo disappointed!

reviews.text: I decided to give this Embassy Suites another chance after a few disappointing stays over the last 3 years. The set up of this place just annoys me. It's difficult to get into off the street. I dislike the parking situation. They do not have a valet so you have to park your own car, take a set of elevators down and then an escalator up to check in. Once checked it you take another elevator to the room. The staff is friendly but it doesn't compensate for the odd set up of this building. I think it's an architectural nightmare. The rooms have been updated slightly with some new fixtures and mirrors in the bathroom. My bathtub had a nice crack in it. The bed was ok. I stayed the previous night at the Hilton Garden Inn on the northwest side of the city which had an amazing bed which probably clouded my judgment.
reviews.title: Emabssy Suites are my Go To Hotel but not in Downtown Indy

reviews.text: This hotel is excellent to stay in while on business in Indianapolis. The location is perfect, its connected to a major downtown mall. And its right above an off-track betting site for all those gamblers out there. The pools great, the spa is great, and the hotel staff is very very helpful. Rooms are very clean and the mattresses are perfect. Will stay again !
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I was in Indianapolis for the first time and the services at the Embassy Suites made my stay more pleasant. They had computers available with printing services for those who couldn't bring a laptop. Internet connection was included at no charge. Complete breakfast included with cook-to-order omeletts among cereal (hot and cold), bread, fruit, yogourt, pancakes, bacon, sausage and more. happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 with complimentary drinks including wines and other alcoholic beverages. The room service maintained the room clean and prepared with a selection of coffe and tea. Also the rooms have a microwave oven and a small refrigerator. On top of all, serurity boxes available at front desk at no cost. I had to study a lot for my workshop and the facilities provided at the hotel were perfect. Located in the heart of downtown, walking distance to many attractions and in the heat of the city. Clean room and huge suites.
reviews.title: Excellent service and extras for business and/or pleasure trip

reviews.text: Great service with excellent rates.
reviews.title: great,clean, welcoming and professional

reviews.text: Thanks
reviews.title: Repeat customer - going back in a week

description: The Embassy Suites Indianapolis Downtown hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to many Indianapolis attractions. The new Lucas Oil Stadium and Conseco Fieldhouse are both just blocks away from our downtown Indianapolis hotel. The Indianapolis Motor Speedway is just 6 miles from the hotel. Our all-suite, full-service, upscale accommodations offer the ideal choice for the business or leisure traveler. Guests stay in a spacious two-room suite complete with a refrigerator, microwave oven and coffee maker. Our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast and complimentary manager's reception are served daily in our lush open air atrium. Unwind and refresh in our indoor pool, fitness center and whirlpool.
